plants.name: Lavandula angustifolia
plants.description: A fragrant perennial shrub known for its aromatic purple flower spikes and silvery-green foliage. English Lavender is popular in gardens and used in essential oils and dried flower arrangements.
plants.location: Mediterranean region, widely cultivated in temperate zones worldwide
plants.funFact: Lavender has been used historically for its calming scent and was even buried with the dead in ancient Egypt.

plants.name: Rhododendron macrophyllum
plants.description: A large flowering shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America, producing large clusters of bell-shaped pink to reddish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded forest areas.
plants.location: Pacific Northwest, United States and Canada
plants.funFact: The Pacific Rhododendron is the state flower of Washington and is valued for its ornamental beauty.

plants.name: Nymphaea alba
plants.description: Floating aquatic perennial with large, round leaves and fragrant white flowers that open during the day and close at night. It inhabits calm freshwater lakes and ponds.
plants.location: Europe and parts of North Africa and Asia
plants.funFact: White water lilies have been culturally significant for centuries, often symbolizing purity and tranquility in various mythologies.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A deciduous tree or shrub producing striking bright red, spiky flowers that attract hummingbirds and butterflies. Often found along riverbanks and in warm temperate climates.
plants.location: South America, especially Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil
plants.funFact: The Cockspur Coral Tree is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay and is admired for its vibrant and unusual flower shape.
